statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Long Beach St 85, UC Irvine 80
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) -- Aaron Nixon scored 22 points and Kevin Houston added 20 as Long Beach State captured its first Big West Conference title in 11 years in an 85-80 victory over UC Irvine Thursday. Sterling Byrd and Kejuan Johnson scored 12 points apiece for the 49'ers (21-7, 11-2), who will be the No. 1 seed in the conference tournament scheduled to begin March 7 in Anaheim. Mark Kelley scored a career-high 24 points and had nine rebounds for UC Irvine (13-17, 6-8). Nic Campbell added 15 points for the Anteaters, who qualified for the conference tournament but will not know who their opponent will be until the regular season play ends Saturday. The Anteaters scored on their first 10 possessions of the second-half to build a 54-44 lead with 14:45 remaining. Nixon then led Long Beach State's comeback by scoring 14 points over the next eight minutes. Johnson's 3-pointer gave the 49'ers a 69-67 lead with 5:55 left in the game. The 49'ers made seven of eight free throws down the stretch to seal the win.
